numlitem.para: All electric drives are operative, and
Takeoff obstacle clearance is not required upon retraction of flaps from takeoff position.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: With one pneumatic drive inoperative, the caution message FLAPS PRIMARY will be displayed during flap operation. The FLAPS PRIMARY message indicates a temporary LE Flap disagreement as a result of slower electrical actuation of the affected LE Flap panels. At the completion of flap motion, with all panels in commanded position, FLAPS PRIMARY will extinguish. Dispatch with FLAPS PRIMARY displayed, or the status message LE MULT DRIVE, is prohibited.
After Takeoff:
Leave flaps in takeoff position until obstacle clearance is assured.
Retract flaps with the flap lever using normal procedures. (The affected leading edge flaps will automatically be retracted electrically at a slower rate than the pneumatic flaps).
If “Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)” is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.

placard.para: Placard near flap lever: "NUMBER ___ L (R) PNEU DR INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Check operation of the leading edge electric drives as follows:

warning.para: ENSURE PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: If all leading edge and trailing edge flaps are not fully retracted, retract them using the flap lever.
To inhibit trailing edge motion and leading edge pneumatic motion, open the following circuit breakers on the P6 panel:

entry.para: PRI LE FLAP DR CONT GRP A (AC)
PRI LE FLAP DR CONT GRP B (AC)

caution.para: DO NOT ELECTRICALLY EXTEND OR RETRACT THE FLAPS MORE THAN ONE TIME IN 5 MINUTES. DAMAGE TO THE MOTOR CAN OCCUR IF THE MOTOR BECOMES TOO HOT.

numlitem.para: Move the flap lever to 5:

The leading edge flaps should remain stationary for approximately 15 seconds, and then extend electrically. Verify that all leading edge flaps extend by observing the EICAS non-normal (expanded) flap display and by observing the flap panels.

note.para: The Caution message FLAPS DRIVE and the status messages LE MULT DRIVE and TE FLAPS will remain displayed on EICAS following this step.

numlitem.para: Move the flap lever to UP:

The leading edge flaps should remain stationary for approximately 15 seconds, and then retract electrically. Verify that all leading edge flaps retract fully by observing the EICAS display and the flap panels.
Close the 5 circuit breakers opened in step B.
Press the ALT FLAPS arm switch. Press the arm switch again and verify the messages FLAPS DRIVE, LE MULT DRIVE, and TE FLAPS are extinguished.

note.para: Status message LE MULT DRIVE may be latched by a single pneumatically inoperative Flap Drive unit. If LE MULT DRIVE remains displayed at conclusion of the maintenance procedure above, dispatch may still be available by accomplishing the steps below and verifying the message was latched by a single pneumatically inoperative Flap drive unit.

The following procedure may be used to verify that LE MULT DRIVE was latched by a single pneumatically inoperative Flap drive unit. If LE MULT DRIVE remains annunciated at the conclusion of the verification procedure, dispatch is not allowed.

warning.para: LEADING AND TRAILING EDGE FLAPS WILL OPERATE. ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Apply power to Flap Control Units (FCUs).
Apply hydraulic and pneumatic power to the flaps.
Move the flap lever to the “UP” detent and wait until the flaps are fully retracted.
Open and close the following circuit breakers located on the P7 panel:
7C10 FLT CONT ELEC 2L AC
7C11 FLT CONT ELEC 2L DC
7C12 FLT CONT ELEC 1L AC
7C13 FLT CONT ELEC 1L DC
7C14 FLT CONT ELEC 1R AC
7C15 FLT CONT ELEC 1R DC
7C16 FLT CONT ELEC 2R AC
7C17 FLT CONT ELEC 2R AC
Verify that all flap related EICAS messages and all existing flap related CMC faults are no longer displayed.
Move the flap lever to the “5” detent and wait until the flaps fully extend. Affected leading edge flaps will operate in the primary electric mode.

caution.para: DO NOT ELECTRICALLY EXTEND OR RETRACT THE FLAPS MORE THAN ONE TIME IN 5 MINUTES. DAMAGE TO THE MOTOR CAN OCCUR IF THE MOTOR BECOMES TOO HOT.

numlitem.para: Verify that LE MULT DRIVE is not displayed.
Move the flap lever to the “UP” detent and wait until the flaps fully retract. Affected leading edge flaps will operate in the primary electric mode.
Verify that LE MULT DRIVE is not displayed.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed if LE MULT DRIVE was displayed at any time after the circuit breakers were open and closed by Step 4 above.
